panels.visual: The Nagini extends her hand toward Lueduo - fingers too long, joints too many, seeming to multiply as he watches. Her golden slit-pupil eyes gleam with ancient hunger. Dark hair coils like living serpents around her shoulders.
panels.dialogue: TheNagini: "You are mine. You have always been mine. I simply had to wait for you to ripen."

panels.visual: Visions hammer into Lueduo's mind - serpent-cities beneath the earth, spires reaching down into endless darkness. Beings coiled around the roots of mountains. A war fought before mammals walked the earth. His bloodline threading through it all, carrying a spark that waited to be rekindled.
panels.narration: Visions hammering into his mind faster than thought - serpent-cities, ancient wars, a bloodline nearly lost.

panels.visual: TALL PANEL: Lueduo wakes in empty desert at dawn. The ruins are gone - simply absent, as if they never existed. He lies in a shallow depression in the sand. On his wrist, two puncture marks weep clear fluid. His eyes have changed - golden now, with pupils that seem to shift. Something coils in his mind, watching, patient.
panels.dialogue: TheNagini: "Go west, little raven. There are others whose paths will cross yours. Broken souls. Useful souls. You will know them when you find them."
